title: Dame Vera Lynn is celebrating her 100th birthday - by releasing a new album
text:
Dame Vera Lynn won't be celebrating with Champagne (Photo: PA) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Dame Vera Lynn is set to be the first singer to have a new album at the age of 100. 
But she won’t be toasting the incredible milestone with her favourite bubbles. 
“As I can’t drink Champagne now, I will be drinking lemonade with a dash of red wine,” she laughed. 
Dame Vera’s new album – called Vera Lynn 100 – is released on March 17. Just days later – on March 20 – she will turn 100. 
The album is being released on Decca Records, the label the singer originally recorded with nearly 80 years ago, at the age of 22. 
Talking to the Mirror, Dame Vera credited her longevity to a sensible diet and the odd tipple. 
“I eat sensibly and have only ever had the occasional glass of wine, which became smaller as the years became bigger,” she says. Read More New Year's Honours 2017: Full list of great and good awarded for services to Britain Decca Records of the front cover of Dame Vera Lynn's new album (Photo: PA) 
Dame Vera, who said she was “surprised” she’d hit 100 years of age, said she will have two celebrations – one for her friends and the other for her family. 
The newly recorded album features new re-orchestrated versions of her most beloved songs, including rare recordings 
Vera is joined by tenor Alfie Boe on We’ll Meet Again. To close the album, the RAF Squadronaires feature on Yours – as a tribute to Dame Vera’s late husband, Harry Lewis, who was a founder member. 
“It was very important to pay tribute to Harry,” she said. “ We always worked together and it was very nice for me to be able to get recognition for him for looking after me so well.... I am thrilled to have all those wonderful artistes singing with me, and wish it could have been in real life.” Read More VE Day: Dame Vera Lynn on why we must always remember the heroes of the Second World War Vera was the The "forces' sweetheart" - who buoyed the nation's spirits in the Second World War (Photo: PA) 
Dame Vera is the only recording artist in the world to have spanned the charts from the 1940s to the 21st century. Her 100th birthday celebration concert, ‘100: A Tribute to Dame Vera Lynn’, is being held at the London Palladium on March 18. Like us on Facebook
